structure.unit: COUNTY ROAD ENGINEER AND MAINTENANCE OF PUBLIC ROADS

law.catch_line: Transportation of engineer -- When fiscal court to furnish.
law.text: In all counties levying a road tax amounting to over fifty thousand dollars ($50,000), the fiscal court shall, and in other counties the fiscal court may, furnish the county engineer with transportation in performing duties connected with the superintending, construction, repair and maintenance of roads in the county. For this purpose the fiscal court may purchase or rent teams or automobiles which may be used by the county judge/executive or committees of the fiscal court or board of commissioners for inspection of the roads to determine recommendations for needed work and repairs.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 4325, 4356v-3.
